text.first: The 'Luhansk Association of Organizations of Persons with Disabilities', established on May 25, 2018, supports people with disabilities and ensures equal opportunities for them. We are a leading organization in Eastern Ukraine focused on social integration and the protection of the rights of persons with disabilities, working to improve their quality of life
text.second: The public union provides social support, protects the rights of people with disabilities, fosters social inclusion, advocates for accessible infrastructure, raises awareness, promotes skill development, and actively involves persons with disabilities in activities

activitiesSection.title: LAOOI's activities in numbers
activitiesSection.description: From the very beginning, our organization has strived for a great goal: to improve the quality of life and protect the rights of people with disabilities, promote social inclusion, and support the awareness of the importance of a barrier-free environment

heroSection.descr: We’re doing everything to show that even in the most challenging times, together we can achieve the incredible

items.question: What is the Luhansk Association of organizations of persons with disabilities?
items.answer: LAOOI is a voluntary public association consisting of individuals and private legal entities, established to uphold and protect human and civil rights and freedoms, meeting the social, economic, cultural, and other needs of its members and/or others

items.question: How can I support your work?
items.answer: You can support us by becoming a volunteer, donating funds or materials, or helping to spread information about our association and our projects

items.question: How can I receive assistance from the association?
items.answer: To get help, you can contact us using the contact information on our website or fill out the help request form available on the site

items.question: Can I become a volunteer/partner?
items.answer: Yes, we are always happy to welcome new volunteers and partners! You can fill out the volunteer application form on our website, and we will get in touch with you to discuss collaboration opportunities

items.question: Do you provide legal or psychological support?
items.answer: Yes, we provide psychological support. The psychologists of the NGO Luhansk Association of Organizations of Persons with Disabilities actively work with people experiencing traumatic events and stress during crisis situations. Our organization understands the importance of helping those facing emotional and psychological difficulties. We offer therapeutic consultations and organize group sessions aimed at supporting psychological well-being. Participants can discuss their experiences in a safe environment, exchange experiences, and find new ways to overcome challenges. Our team of qualified psychologists and social workers provides professional assistance to help everyone restore their inner balance and strengthen their emotional health. We believe that together we can overcome all difficulties and provide reliable support for those in need

items.question: Where can I find more information about your programs and activities?
items.answer: You can find more information about our programs and events on our website in the 'News' section or by following us on our social media

description.text: On May 25, 2018, the Public Union 'Luhansk Association of Organizations of Persons with Disabilities' (LAOOI) was established, striving to improve the lives of people with disabilities in the region. This was a day when hope and determination united to create a system of mutual support and ensure equal opportunities for all who need help.

From the very beginning, our organization aimed for a significant goal: improving the quality of life and protecting the rights of people with disabilities, promoting social inclusion, and fostering awareness of the value of a barrier-free environment.
Over the years, we have become a leading civic institution in eastern Ukraine, proving that together, we can change the world.

Each of our projects was implemented with great enthusiasm to make life better for those around us. We provided people with disabilities with assistive rehabilitation devices under the 'Care' program, conducted video experiments assessing the accessibility of social facilities, taught computer literacy to seniors and people with disabilities, and operated an inclusive network of community advisors in Luhansk and Donetsk regions. We organized a Volunteer Support Center during the COVID-19 pandemic and ensured the accessibility of transportation and infrastructure.

The full-scale war changed our lives and plans. The temporary occupation of Luhansk forced us to leave our homes—most of us for the second time. In 2014, we had to leave Luhansk city, and in 2022, Sievierodonetsk. Yet, we did not give up. We proved resilient enough to face new challenges. Under martial law, our activities focused on crisis evacuation, humanitarian aid, setting up temporary shelters, and providing psychosocial support. We supported rehabilitation centers, shared best practices, and worked on transforming communities in crisis.

Our knowledge and experience became even more crucial. As before, we represent the interests of persons with disabilities before governmental bodies, monitor accessibility standards in reconstruction projects, implement innovative technologies, and promote the GESI approach (Gender Equality and Social Inclusion).

We do all this to show that even in the most challenging times, together we can achieve incredible things. Our story is one of resilience, unwavering faith in a better future, and the belief that each of us can make this world more just and accessible for all. This is the story of the Public Union 'Luhansk Association of Organizations of Persons with Disabilities'—an organization that, even in the darkest times, does not lose the light of hope.
In May–June 2024, a new cycle of strategic planning took place, resulting in the development of a strategy for the 2024–2025 period.

The new strategy considers modern societal trends characterized by people’s struggle to survive amidst simultaneous changes in various spheres and aspects, along with the lack of psychological support.
The strategy for the period until 2026 was developed and adopted in strict adherence to the principles of inclusivity, transparency, and accountability.

strategy.title: Mission
strategy.description: To unite hearts and efforts to create a society of equal opportunities, where every person has the right to a dignified life, support, and development. Even in the most challenging times, we strive to build a world defined by hope, inclusion, and accessibility

strategy.title: Vision
strategy.description: We aim to create a society where every individual, regardless of their abilities, has access to all aspects of life, feels valued, and is a full-fledged member of the community. A society where inclusion, respect, and support form the foundation, and everyone has the opportunity to realize their potential and live with dignity, free from barriers and discrimination

values.title: INCLUSION
values.description: Creating an environment where everyone has equal opportunities and access to all spheres of life

values.title: RESPECT
values.description: Recognizing the dignity and value of every person, regardless of their abilities

values.title: SOLIDARITY
values.description: Supporting and uniting efforts to achieve common goals

values.title: TRANSPARENCY
values.description: Openness and honesty in all actions and decisions

values.title: RESPONSIBILITY
values.description: Awareness and acceptance of responsibilities toward the community and society

values.title: INNOVATION
values.description: Implementing advanced technologies and approaches to improve the lives of people with disabilities

values.title: RESILIENCE
values.description: The ability to adapt and act effectively even in challenging conditions

values.title: ADVOCACY
values.description: Defending the rights and interests of people with disabilities at all levels

values.title: HUMANITY
values.description: Demonstrating care, compassion, and support in relationships with others

values.title: DEVELOPMENT
values.description: Continuous improvement and learning to achieve the best results

description.after: We aim to improve the quality of life for vulnerable population groups by employing a systematic approach to providing humanitarian aid; developing a network of inclusive community advisors; optimizing the social services system; actively participating in the planning and implementation of post-war reconstruction; and promoting inclusive veteran policies. We will work to ensure accessibility and equality so that every individual can realize their potential and feel like a full-fledged member of society, free from barriers and discrimination

mainAreasSection.title: Over the next two years, the organization aims to focus on five key areas of activity:

areas.title: Humanitarian aid
areas.description: Enhancing organizational efficiency and implementing a systematic approach to delivering humanitarian assistance for vulnerable population groups

areas.title: Inclusive community advisors
areas.description: Developing a network of inclusive community advisors to promote the principles of equality and accessibility at the level of territorial communities

areas.title: Social services
areas.description: Facilitating the involvement of non-governmental actors in the social service delivery system, including obtaining official social service provider status for LAOOI, and directly delivering specific social services in pilot communities

areas.title: Reconstruction
areas.description: Participating in the planning and implementation of projects and programs for rebuilding residential, social, and infrastructure facilities, focusing on the needs of persons with disabilities

areas.title: Inclusive veteran policy
areas.description: Developing and implementing policies aimed at supporting veterans, with a focus on addressing the challenges they face after completing military service
